content.statement: dvt-004-duplex-ultrasound is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Deep-Vein-Thrombosis that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding dvt-004-duplex-ultrasound helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of dvt-004-duplex-ultrasound include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of dvt-004-duplex-ultrasound.

definitions_glossary.compression_ultrasound: Technique using transducer pressure to assess vein collapse
definitions_glossary.incompressibility: Failure of vein to collapse completely under pressure
definitions_glossary.proximal_dvt: Thrombus in popliteal vein or above
definitions_glossary.distal_dvt: Thrombus in calf veins only (below popliteal)

examination_technique.patient_position: Supine, leg externally rotated, knee slightly flexed
examination_technique.orientation: Transverse for compression, longitudinal for Doppler
examination_technique.compression_intervals: Every 1-2 cm along course of veins

indeterminate: Partial compressibility (may indicate old or resolving thrombus)
Technically limited study (obesity, edema, overlying wounds)

proximal_plus_serial.approach: Proximal veins only; repeat in 5-7 days if negative
proximal_plus_serial.rationale: Catches propagating calf DVT before it becomes proximal

whole_leg_single.rationale: Single test, identifies all DVT, but calf DVT management controversial

definition.@value: Primary diagnostic imaging modality for DVT using compression to assess vein patency

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Interpret ultrasound findings for DVT diagnosis
Explain the difference between proximal-only and whole-leg strategies
Understand limitations of ultrasound for calf vein DVT
clinical_pearls: Incompressibility = DVT, even if you can't see the thrombus
Proximal sensitivity is excellent, calf sensitivity is limited
If negative but suspicious, repeat in 5-7 days or do whole-leg
Chronic DVT may show partial compressibility with wall thickening

medicalCode.description: Duplex scan of extremity veins, complete bilateral study
